Reviews.Title: “Good for singles -- low budget”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1984
Reviews.Content: Nothing is missing in the room but it's just the basics. Don't expect anything more! No good views - rooms are narrow same as bathroom. Room service is good. Staff are helpful. No safe in the rooms .. If you wanna leave your valuable stuff, leave them at reception's safe. In brief, it's not recommended for honeymoon. It's good if you are looking for a low budget hotel. Cheers John

Reviews.Title: “Its well to try”
Reviews.Author: nadine25112011
Reviews.Content: I spent more than three times in grsnd tahir its really very nice 1) the location is near to bus station 2)the reception guys very helpful 3)the rooms were quit nice clean and confertable4) the breakfast was okey totally i loved the hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: betzMilano
Reviews.Content: I was at the Grand Thair in august 2011 on my own, the place is clean and the staff is nice. The hotel is open till late in the night and is very close to the metro station. It is not in the city centre but is still quite close to it and in august it was a safe place to reach, in the night as well. The breakfast was good and big and there is one internet station too. In my room there were: tv - fridge - strongbox and everyday my room was cleaned and bed made. If you don't want nothing in special, it is a good place to choose.

Reviews.Title: “3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niky_p
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife was there for U2 concert (6-th of September) We book the hotel from travel aganecy and stay there for 2 days. We pay 60 EUR per room/per day (for example on the reception the price for double room was 90 EUR). See what we tink about it: 1. For sure Grand Tahir is not 3* world standart hotel but for Turkey/ISTANBUL he is OK. The Hotel is situated in Laleli neighbourhood (Leather shops area in European part of the city). The area is completely save.The hotel is clean and quiet. Basic English!!! 2. The hotel don't have parking and you can't stop in front of the hotel but there is a parking 200 m. away (take the bellboy to show you the way, don't give him more then 2-3 TRL) .The parking owner is very polite just give him the keys of the car and don't worry. The price is 16 TRL /24 h and if you stay more than 2 days you must give a deposit. They don't speak any language except Turkish (haha he know only EXCUSE ME but don't worry about that you will understand everything) 3. Internet: in the lobby, we was on 4 th floor and the signal was good. There is a password (telephone number of the hotel ) :) 4. Rooms: just a suggestion ask on the reception (or your agent) to give you a double bed room (with two separated beds) she is bigger than the double with king size bed. I post the pictures! The rooms are old but clean. You have air-condition, TV (1 Italian music channel and many Turkish), refrigerator but empty (strange for me?!?!) Hot water all the time, hair-drier, shower, towels were old but clean, opening windows. Wardrobe have only a few hangers and no shelfs. 5. Breakfast: not enough and miserably. (espresso only in STARBUCKS :) ) 6. Location: The hotel is located next to the Aksaray tram station which is connected directly to the main attractions of Istanbul (1.5 TRL per jeton, 2 stops, tram number 38 to Sultanahmet, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace) It is also close to the Aksaray metro station. Enjoy of your staying! Brgrds Nick

Reviews.Title: “puzzling”
Reviews.Author: carol5-2007
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay in this hotel at the beg of April 2010, fully paid in advance. When we arrived, first the receptionist couldn't find our booking, then we were told that the room was being renovated and we were offered a room in a hotel a few yards away. We accepted this, being evening and no time to find an alternative. The replacement was supposed to be also three star - this I doubt. It was small, without enough space for clothes so that we had to keep our clothes in our suitcases and try to manoever around these on the floor, also noisy until late in the evening even being woken at 1.30am with next room's television. Passing the Grand Tahir for the next few days, we could see no evidence of renovations - we were annoyed with ourselves for not standing our ground and insisting we get what we had paid for. We felt we had been short-changed. Location for sight-seeing is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It was good place to stay but next timeI would choose 5 * hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritaLondon
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was given the smallest room of the hotel (considering the size of it) but I managed to change it the next day. The beds were quite hard so I never slept very well there. Good thing was air conditioning. The hotel was clean and quiet. I was travelling across the sea every day so for me the location was not so good but I could not be bothered to change it. The breakfast was ok for first time but it never changed and the choice was very small, did not really enjoy it. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not as clean as should be!”
Reviews.Author: Beddington210
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel, the rooms were not dusted or cleaned as we would have liked but apart from that we had no problems! Friendly staff but only basic English. Good location near to the Tram Way which links most of the tourist sights. They phoned & arranged the hamam & Orient House dinner & dance show, both of whom send a taxi for you & take you home afterwards. Interesting Turkish breakfast!!! Considering that they have western guests I would have expected a better selection of western food!!! ( A selection of only 2 cereal). The web site leads you to believe it is better than it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: MariFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days in Grand Tahir Hotel in the beginning of May. The best features of the hotel were location and the lobby. Hotel is near Aksaray tramstation and walking distance (1km) from Aksaray metrostation (easily accessed from AtatÃ¼rk Airport). Breakfast was poor and room was really small. We stayed in twin bed room and I recommend to choose double bed room, while it looked bigger. Bathroom was not 3* standard, more likely 1* (old, sewer smell came into the bathroom, showers were originals, etc.) Service was quite poor as well and it was difficult to get any smiles from staff. If you want to stay in good location and don't mind the shabby settings, I recommend. Othervise, I recommend to choose some other hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Tahir Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Cad Yesil Tulumba Sok No.17 | Laleli, Istanbul 7200, Turkey
